short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Brings the old header links back.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Recently the GitHub header became simpler (https://github.com/blog/2022-an-updated-header-just-for-you), which is not bad. However, it removes some links that are important to me (and probably for others): the explore link and the direct link to the logged user profile.

After installing this little extension, the user has these links back (see the screenshot).

The extension is open-source, on GitHub: https://github.com/IonicaBizau/github-old-header
